section.title: Drilldowns
section.para: Drilldowns are a special resource available within every Data Category that contains Data Items.

As data items are identified by UIDs in API calls such as creating Profile Items, a way is required of translating human-readable choices into these UIDs. This is particularly important for large categories, such as UK car models, which can contain many thousands of data items.

Also, data item UIDs may be different on different AMEE platforms for the same item. Because of this, data item UIDs should never be hardcoded into client apps. Instead, you should use the drilldown resource (which doesn't change) to obtain the UIDs, which can then be cached. Drilldown details may be safely hardcoded, so that you don't necessarily have to iterate through the choices each time if you already know which item you want to get to.

section.title: Lookup a Data Item UID
section.para: Drilldowns are performed via repeated accesses to the drilldown resource for each category. Each call to the resource will give a list of choices. The API client can then select one of these and provide it as a parameter to the next drilldown call. When the sequence of choices uniquely identifies one data item, a single choice named 'uid' is returned. This is the UID that should be used to refer to the chosen Data Item when creating Profile Items (see ).

tr.td: Any number of choices and the values chosen. See below for detailed explanation. Choices must be provided in the correct order.

section.para: The response body contains a number of sections. The 'choices' section lists available drill choices. The 'selections' sections shows choices that have already been made.

section.title: First Choice
section.para: The first request has no parameters, so fetches the options for the first drill choice.

section.title: Second Choice
section.para: In this example, the user has picked 'diesel' as the selection for the first choice. This is passed as a URL parameter to the second request.

section.title: Final Result
section.para: This category has only two drill choices, so two selections are enough to fully identify a data item. The user has selected 'large' for the size choice in this example. The UID of the selected data item appears as a choice named 'uid'. If user input is not required, and you know that you want to the large diesel car data item in your application, you can use this form directly without having to do the previous two calls.
